headline: Artichoke & Spinach Dip Restaurant Style
description: This spinach artichoke dip uses jarred Alfredo sauce for a decadent, creamy twist to an old favorite that goes great with breadsticks and crackers.

video.description: An amazing dip that’s as good as the original restaurant version.
video.name: Artichoke & Spinach Dip Restaurant Style

name: Artichoke & Spinach Dip Restaurant Style
recipeIngredient: 1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Place garlic in a small baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until soft, 20 to 30 minutes. Allow to cool enough to handle, then squeeze out softened garlic cloves from skins into a large bowl.

Add artichoke hearts, spinach, Alfredo-style pasta sauce, mozzarella cheese, cream cheese, and Parmesan cheese to garlic cloves in the bowl; mix until well combined. Spread into an 8x8-inch baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheeses are melted and bubbly, about 30 minutes. Serve warm.

review.reviewBody: I am in love with this recipe!!! only thing i do differently is use baked pita bread for dipping

My family loves this! Sometimes I use garlic alfredo sauce. And I add a small amount of crushed red pepper ( Careful! as a little goes a long way). I also double the garlic cloves. It is always a request for family gatherings.
it was great!!!

Absolutely love this recipe. It’s always a crowd pleaser. The Alfredo sauce is the secret ingredient which brings it to another level making it better than restaurant dip. Sometimes when I want to be fancy I’ll roast an entire head of garlic.

This was extremely good, the best dip I’ve ever had!! I wanted to follow the recipe exactly but cheated a bit. I used all of the cream cheese I had (8 oz) and topped it with some mozzarella. Other than that I followed the recipe. (I would say make sure you use an Alfredo sauce you know you like. I thought it was weird at first but it was so good.) I was pleasantly surprised how good this was that I made an account to review this. Thank you to the owner of this recipe and those in comments that had suggestions! Notes: The Alfredo I used was: Cucina Fresca (I feel this is a great Alfredo for this. I used all of it pretty much) I did get marinated Artichoke hearts (quartered) but washed them off in water and drained them to get the seasoning off of them. I’d suggest not getting marinated artichokes if possible or wash them off gently. I cut them in halves after that.

Recipe was very good, I made some changes. 7 oz of frozen spinach, used Parmesan and Romano cheese. Added some Tabasco,cayenne, garlic powder and garlic salt. Because I wanted to make several smaller servings I used a mixer to mix the Alfredo and cream cheese. Also added 1/3 cup of mozzarella to the dip. The remaining mozzarella I added to the top and baked at 350 until cheese was melted. Roasted garlic added great flavor.
For me, needed a pinch of cayenne, paprika, and/or hot sauce. But was otherwise completely on-point! I skipped the oven and heated it in a slow cooker on high until bubbly, about 1-2 hrs.
Delicious.
Awful. Too much alfredo taste but entire dish was too thick. The flavor was boring - distasteful.

AMAZING!!! Better then Chili's haha
Even my sister that doesn't like spinach dip LOVED this! Delish!!!
Really good! My guests asked for this recipe before leaving.

Smells great! In the oven! I didn’t know if you were supposed to layer it or mix it all together The recipe did not say to mix! But even soft cream cheese is difficult to spread on top of Parmesan cheese I may write another review after we taste it!!
This wasn't bad but like others have said, the taste of the Alfredo sauce overwhelmed everything else. It ultimately felt heavy and filling but a little tasteless, like it was missing something.
This is the best dip ever!!! I make it just as described. I took it to a party and it was the first food to be devoured. Thanks for sharing this recipe... Making it again and again..

Great recipe! I Followed recipe as directed but switched cheese amounts, more Parmesan & less mozzarella, and also added about 1/3 c sour cream. The pretzel crisps were really good with the dip. This will be my go to for a spinach & artichoke dip. Thanks for sharing Terran!
This is excellent! I took it to a party and there was nothing left; everyone loved it. Looks good, tastes even better.
This dip is amazing! I use a crock pot to help keep it warm. I also didn't use a whole can of artichokes either.
It’s been a favorite for years. The Alfredo sauce is so smart. Creamy and rich.

This was incredibly easy, even when I couldn't get garlic to roast. I popped this in a crock pot for work with Ragu alfredo sauce and people still raved about the dip (I might get unsalted tortilla chips, though, to help lower the amount of salt). This is a must-try if you want something easy to bring to a pitch-in.
Increased mozzarella to 1 1/2 cups and cream cheese to 8 oz. I mixed all of the ingredients together first and then put in the pa,
Delicious recipe! I’ll definitely add this to my collection of keepers to make again in the future.
No changes. Best ever!
I used a pre-grated Italian cheese combination and would add more garlic in next time. Other than that it was quick easy and delicious.

I followed the exact recipe and it came out so delicious! My boyfriend who is incredibly picky loved it also. I love cheese, so I sprinkled some more mozzarella cheese towards the end and left it for an additional 5-7 minutes. Made some homemade tortilla chips and all I can say is this is going to be my next new appetizer I bring to all my gatherings.
Delicious!!! Added some extra motz cheese and read other reviews to see suggestions.
I added the whole block of cream cheese and extra mozzarella and Parmesan.It was delicious!My boys devoured it!A great recipe,easy to make and delicious!
Followed the recipe as written. And definitely will make it again.
Yum Yum Yum
My family loves this recipe. It's a party favorite.
This was delicious!!! Easy to make..will definitely make again!!!

I love this recipe. I have used it so many times. I think that the refrigerated Alfredo is key! I tried it once with the regular Alfredo that comes in a jar because it was the only thing my local super market carried and I won't do that again, even if it means taking an extra trip to another store. I've also done this in a Crock-Pot for Thanksgiving potlucks, just throw it all in, mix it up, and set it on high until it heats through - I usually give it about 2 hours, but I usually double or triple the recipe :)
Made homemade alfredo sauce and used fresh spinach instead of frozen. Yum! I didn't bother with roasting the garlic, but I'm sure it would be delicious also!

This is my go to recipe. I cook the garlic differently because cooking it in a baking pan dries it out a bit. 
Take the skins off the garlic and cut the ends. Wrap them in a foil ball and cook until mushy. Then I make a paste and place it in the dip. 
Roasted garlic is a must in this recipe!
-Use the whole thing of cream cheese 
-use Bertolli Alfredo sauce 
-dump everything in the crock pot instead of baking because it’s just so much easier!
Made it for Sunday snacking while we cooked and everyone in my house loved it!!!!!!
The end result was too chunky for my taste, so I threw it into the blender & it came out awesome. What a delicious dip!
I’ve been making this recipe for years and it’s always a hit! My go to for gatherings.
It was very good but I would add a little garlic next time just to boost the flavor.

I've made and shared this recipe many, many times. It is so wonderful. If you're making this for a party, do yourself a favor and double the recipe, everyone will go crazy for this! As other reviewers have said, mix all ingredients before placing in the oven. My worst problem is finding the right crackers or breads to serve it on! I would never be with this recipe!
My family loved it!
At first, I did not mix it, so it was very concentrated. But once I did it was very satisfying.
Love it love it love it
Love the recipe very easy to make, I did make a mistake and used the entire cream cheese but it was still delicious and everyone raved about it. Yes I will make again at another party.
Use 2 cups of mozzarella cheese and 1/2 cup or parm/Romano cheese. Add 1 tsp. Of salt!
Big hit at a party I brought it to. I did use a whole package of cream cheese and a whole jar of Alfredo. I also added more mozzarella.

Made this for a gathering of friends. Someone else brought another spinach dip. No contest! This recipe won hands down, even the person who made the other spinach dip said this recipe was so much better. I followed the suggestion to use refrigerated Alfredo sauce and the whole pkg of cream cheese. It was outstanding.

I really wanted to like this but unfortunately it missed the mark. I brought this to a party and it was practically untouched at the end of the night. I saw people throwing away what they did take. I was excited to try this with the alfredo sauce but it left a strange taste, and the dip was pretty much bland otherwise. I followed the recipe exactly, except added a full block of cream cheese per the recommendation of many other users and I eyeballed the amount of spinach because I had a much larger bag than 10 oz. Next time I'd replace the alfredo with the standard sour cream/mayo or greek yogurt mixture and increase the roasted garlic to 5-6 cloves.
made this and it was absolutely delicious. was definitely a hit.
Wonderful. Sometimes I choose to use some extra spinach instead of the artichoke.

I made this for a House Warming Party. I doubled the recipe and everyone loved it. They even said that they would like to have the recipe. I found it easy and I will make it again for other get to gathers. Lady D
Made exactly like recipe. it was very good
Made this for the first time, my family absolutely loved it!!!
This recipe is amazing. Everyone loves it when I make it.!
Thought this would be really great having read the reviews, but it was a real disappointment. Definitely not restaurant worthy. Followed the recipe exactly. Tasted like Alfredo sauce with spinach.
Great base dip recipe. Few ingredients. Made it for the Super Bowl. Everybody loved it.
This is so simple and very tasty. The best I have made so far.
This is absolutely the best spinach dip recipe I have ever made. My family asks for it at every party!
Fantastic everyone loved it
Family and friends enjoyed this dished. I double the recipe and added 1/3 of half and half. It made the dish creamer. This is a keeper. This is better than the restaurants.

Going to try this weekend...agree that could the amount of seasoning in the alfredo and then also adding the asiago and romano as well (sounds deliciously rich) be possibly too overpowering? How about trying it with a reduced cream of onion soup and cheeses? Would also like to try this tossed with grilled chicken and angel hair pasta or even the same on pizza crust. Sounds like you could do a lot with this....

This was hands down the BEST recipe I have ever made! Although i did use all of these ingredients i did not follow the measurements that they give. I feel like if i used more Alfredo sauce it would ruin it so i changed it up & it tasted just like the restaurants! Could not stop eating it. Everyone loved it!! I only used about half (or a cup) of regular Alfredo and just chopped my garlic up. I also used all of the 8oz cream cheese. I also added a little bit of garlic powder, some salt & pepper. It turned out so creamy & delicious. I’m making more tomorrow. All the other recipes for spinach dip are so different than this one & they tasted not so good. This one is the best!! Going to make it forever now. Yummm! So glad I found this recipe.

I'm so happy to find this recipe, it was delish! I have made versions of this recipe before and this recipe is by far the best. I love the addition of alfredo sauce. I used a10oz tub from the refrigerated section and it was perfect. Next time I will roast the garlic but due to time, I just used fresh raw garlic & it was fine and still tasty. I also added some cayenne pepper & few drops of hot sauce & also added additional mozzarella cheese blend. I too mixed it all up together and did not layer it & used entire block of cream cheese, per many of the other reviews. I also (per reviews) did not bake & put in my mini crock pot ~ PERFECT!

I made it exactly as written. We did not like it at all. It is not like any restaurant spinach and artichoke dip I have ever had. It was too salty. My husband and I had a few bites. I'll never bother with this again.

this ended up tasting amazing. the only thing I changed was: whole 8 ounces of cream cheese, salt to taste, and I used prego Alfredo sauce because I already had it. I literally wouldn't change anything else about this.

This was good. I wanted to serve in a mini-slow cooker, so I heated all ingredients on the stove and then transferred to the crock. I added salt, garlic powder, garlic salt, and about 1tbsp lemon juice until it tasted the way I wanted. I prefer a fresher-tasting dip, but this was rich and was restaurant-style as promised.

I'm not a big fan of artichokes, but my husband is, so I made it for him for the first time last summer, and we both loved it. Only thing that I changed is using fresh spinach, instead of frozen. It just takes a little longer to chop, but it's definitely worth it. I'm making it for the third time right now. The smell of garlic roasting in the oven is also a plus. Will for sure make again!

This was excellent! I used all light ingredients to keep the stats down and it still tasted great. I never even got to have any at the party I brought it to because it was gone before I went up to get my food. That's usually a pretty good sign that everyone liked it. As a note, I cooked on stovetop and then put it in a crock pot to keep warm during the party.
I am only giving this three stars because it is missing something. I'm thinking of adding cayenne pepper next time. It was good but very bland.
Only change I made was to use the entire 8 oz. of cream cheese instead of half. Came out awesome! Can't stop eating it.
I have only one problem with this recipe, I can't stop eating it. I do agree however that half the alfredo and 8oz cream cheese is better.
This was so good that I had to make more. My husband and kids said that it tasted better then what they serve in restaurants.
Family Favorite!!
This tastes so delicious; just like a restaurant. I made it with all ingredients called for but mixed all together rather than layering. This is the recipe my family always requests

I love Chef John's version, but it gets a little pricey. I took this recipe and added hot sauce, nutmeg, and pepper per his recipe. It really took this recipe to the next level. All the guests loved it!
Love this! My twist is using extra cream cheese and adding cayenne pepper. It's a great kick!
This recipe is so easy and is very good. Everyone loved it. This will be great for SEC football Saturdays!!!
My nephew doesn't like spinach but he loved this dip.
This was good! I usually don't like Alfredo sauce in a jar but I went ahead and tried it. I used garlic powder and I'm sure that fresh garlic would make it even better.
After reading other reviews I decided to double all of the cheeses and also double the garlic. I would make this again but would add a little salt next time.
Everyone loves this dip every time I make it! Its versatile too. If I don't have Alfredo sauce, I use extra parmesan.
Liked it, but was a little heavy. Have another recipe that I've used in the past that I love. Just wanted to try it to see if there was something even better.

Absolutely amazing tastes exactly or even better from milestones restaurant here in Alberta. Hats off to the person who added this recipe here.
Cheers!

This dip was fantastic and fairly easy to make. I added a small can of green chiles to add a hint of spice and I used the whole brick of cream cheese instead of half. It was so creamy and perfect with pita chips. It even still tastes great reheated in the microwave.
Made recipe exactly as written. Was very good. Nice and creamy. Everyone loved it.
Hello, can I use a fresh spinach in the recipe?

I will definitely make this appetizer again, my entire family loved it. Changes I made.....I used already crushed garlic, and I used marinated (jar) artichoke hearts, I cut them up smaller, and I added some of the tangy amazing artichoke marinade to the mix, I definitely used a little more spinach, cheeses, and the entire block of cream cheese...it was amazing. A huge family hit
Better then most restaurants
Actually used this as a main dish. Fresh vegetables and garlic bread were used to scoop up this dip.
My family loved it!
Really does taste like the dip local chains serve
Made it exactly as recipe calls for and our family loved it!!
This is as good as any dip you would find in a restaurant! Loved it and will be keeping this recipe to make again!
I used artichoke tapenade and it was delicious!
I agree with MUIRZ1. I would rather leave out the alfredo sauce and use cream and asiago cheeses. Publix makes an excellent cold spinach and artichoke dip with the cream cheese and asiago!
MAKE AGAIN
I made this as directed but eat it with tortilla chips and it was pretty good it was a little too bland for my taste.

It was OK, but certainly not memorable in a good way. It was simply too bland. The second day, I added Mrs. Dash and some more Parmesan cheese and it seemed to help a bit. I will make it again, but follow others' advice and not use Alfredo sauce from a jar (even thou it was quite expensive). I may even cut down on the amount of sauce.

Loved it. I used Roasted garlic Alfredo is was easy and a big hit in my family.

Cathy in Chicago
Love it! So do all my relatives. That is my "signature" dip now. They expect every gathering now. I don't mind, it's fairly easy to make.

Instead of a dip, I make this hot, toss it with fettucini noodles and top it with sliced grilled chicken and make "Spinich Artichoke Pasta with Chicken" It is the best of two worlds. You don't need a special occasion to make the dip, you can make it into a quick dinner anytime!!! My husband's favorite!
